NEWS

Source: vignettes/news.Rmd
news.Rmd



Package releases

Original version was FATE-HD, developed and used in papers such as Boulangeat 2014, [Carboni], [Barros]. It was only C++ code, and all modules were linked together (LIGHT, DISPERSAL, HABSUIT, SEEDING, DISTURBANCE).

Refinements to the model, and integration of the C++ code within an R package, as well as new modules development, were meant to facilitate the use and spread of the FATE model.

Version 1.0.0

  • all steps included in one tool (PRE-FATE, FATE, POST-FATE), that can be easily installed on all OS (Mac, Unix, Windows)
  • a simplification of some structural equations of the model (see FATE tutorial - Modelling framework)
  • 8 modules that can be turned on/off (see FATE tutorial - Modules)
  • a shiny interface, and a complete documentation and manual (! coming soon !), with meaningful examples from real dataset



Contents

Developed by Wilfried Thuiller, Damien Georges, Isabelle Boulangeat, Maya Guéguen, Guillaume Dupouy.
